name: Marlowe-Crowne Social Desirability Scale
description: A 33-item measure of the tendency to give socially desirable responses. Used to detect response bias and assess need for approval in research settings.
reference: Crowne, D. P., & Marlowe, D. (1960). A new scale of social desirability independent of psychopathology. Journal of Consulting Psychology, 24(4), 349-354.
instructions: Listed below are a number of statements concerning personal attitudes and traits. Read each item and decide whether the statement is true or false as it pertains to you personally.

questions.name: mcsds_1
questions.description: Before voting I thoroughly investigate the qualifications of all the candidates.

questions.name: mcsds_2
questions.description: I never hesitate to go out of my way to help someone in trouble.

questions.name: mcsds_3
questions.description: It is sometimes hard for me to go on with my work if I am not encouraged.

questions.name: mcsds_4
questions.description: I have never intensely disliked anyone.

questions.name: mcsds_5
questions.description: On occasion I have had doubts about my ability to succeed in life.

questions.name: mcsds_6
questions.description: I sometimes feel resentful when I don't get my way.

questions.name: mcsds_7
questions.description: I am always careful about my manner of dress.

questions.name: mcsds_8
questions.description: My table manners at home are as good as when I eat out in a restaurant.

questions.name: mcsds_9
questions.description: If I could get into a movie without paying and be sure I was not seen I would probably do it.

questions.name: mcsds_10
questions.description: On a few occasions, I have given up doing something because I thought too little of my ability.

questions.name: mcsds_11
questions.description: I like to gossip at times.

questions.name: mcsds_12
questions.description: There have been times when I felt like rebelling against people in authority even though I knew they were right.

questions.name: mcsds_13
questions.description: No matter who I'm talking to, I'm always a good listener.

questions.name: mcsds_14
questions.description: I can remember 'playing sick' to get out of something.

questions.name: mcsds_15
questions.description: There have been occasions when I took advantage of someone.

questions.name: mcsds_16
questions.description: I'm always willing to admit it when I make a mistake.

questions.name: mcsds_17
questions.description: I always try to practice what I preach.

questions.name: mcsds_18
questions.description: I don't find it particularly difficult to get along with loudmouthed, obnoxious people.

questions.name: mcsds_19
questions.description: I sometimes try to get even rather than forgive and forget.

questions.name: mcsds_20
questions.description: When I don't know something I don't at all mind admitting it.

questions.name: mcsds_21
questions.description: I am always courteous, even to people who are disagreeable.

questions.name: mcsds_22
questions.description: At times I have really insisted on having things my own way.

questions.name: mcsds_23
questions.description: There have been occasions when I felt like smashing things.

questions.name: mcsds_24
questions.description: I would never think of letting someone else be punished for my wrongdoings.

questions.name: mcsds_25
questions.description: I never resent being asked to return a favor.

questions.name: mcsds_26
questions.description: I have never been irked when people expressed ideas very different from my own.

questions.name: mcsds_27
questions.description: I never make a long trip without checking the safety of my car.

questions.name: mcsds_28
questions.description: There have been times when I was quite jealous of the good fortune of others.

questions.name: mcsds_29
questions.description: I have almost never felt the urge to tell someone off.

questions.name: mcsds_30
questions.description: I am sometimes irritated by people who ask favors of me.

questions.name: mcsds_31
questions.description: I have never felt that I was punished without cause.

questions.name: mcsds_32
questions.description: I sometimes think when people have a misfortune they only got what they deserved.

questions.name: mcsds_33
questions.description: I have never deliberately said something that hurt someone's feelings.
